content.label:
I love this app and love how well the music goes with the action as things get more and more intense. When I sit down and play, I find myself saying I can try one more time to finish the level, and then it turns into 5-10+ times.

The only thing I could ask for from this app, is please update it to support the iPhone X. I know it‚Äôs been quite a while since this app was updated, but I would enjoy this game so much more if it were updated. Until then, I find it much more enjoyable on my iPad.
Wish it would be updated for iPhone X though.
Great app otherwise
It‚Äôs not a bad game for those who like it, but it‚Äôs definitely NOT worth three dollars :/
No updates in over 2 years and definitely no iPhone X support.

If you like losing then you will love this game. There are no easy settings so you can play and work your way to the harder settings. What fun is a game that you lose within the first few moves and have to constantly keep starting over? Wish I would have saved my money for a more enjoyable game.
If you get motion sickness easily, this is not the game for you. Played for one minute and my head is spinning already!
very challenging game that will make your eyes go sharingan mode.

So after playing for days I finally beat all levels and hyper hexagonest, the ending is so satisfying along with the levels leading up to it! This is fantastic and I'm sure I'll come back every day to beat my records. Worth the buy if you have a lot of time on your hands to master it!

This game is very simple interface menus and controls.  The play sessions can be as short or long as need be.  Sometimes play for 2 minutes others upwards of 45.  It doesn't pretend to be a main evening entertainment kind of thing. It's just get in play get out.

The game itself is rewarding.  It is fairly difficult but often instant retry keeps it from being frustrating.  It has some visual deception as a game mechanic that you need to aclimate to but you will aclimate to it.
Whenever I get bored I go back to this game. It never gets old.

title.label: Not getting it and not worth money

content.label:
Every game last 15 sec if your good.  Controls are WAY oversensitive.  Die 90% of time cause stupid little pixel moved a fragment too far.  Other times its because the pixel doesn't move left if you touch an apparent dead spot on left side of screen.  
Find you are also too small.  Way to easy to lose yourself.  

Simply do not understand others enjoyment of this game.  Am not seeing addictive nature at all.  Just frustration with bad controls.  Game is strictly one dimensional.

This game is in no way worth $2.99.

I bought this game because I love the PC version. Unfortunately there seems to be either dead zones on the screen or lag. At first I thought I was just losing, but there have been times when I touch the screen to move the marker and it doesn't respond. This is super frustrating, especially when you're a few seconds from beating your record.
Hell yes!
I paid $2.99 for this and can't find a settings menu for sound.

I love this game. It's simple yet challenging. There is one minor bug where sometimes the tap won't register on the right side of the screen. It's intermittent and not easily replicable but if you've played this game you know that one slight miss is everything. I thought it might be my phone but I'm on my second iPhone and it still happens. Even with that this is a high recommend.

I've never experienced this with a game before. I wanted to like this game, despite the fact I've never stayed alive more than 8 seconds. The game itself is simple, but the first level is "Hard", so that should be a sign. The rotating screen and changing colors turned my stomach after about 10 minutes each time I played.
Who else came here because of Serponges Altergame on Geometry Dash? Awesome game.. but needs more features to be worth 3 dollars -_-
The game is great and all but the announcer is so annoying that it made me want to quit

I've spent hours playing this game, usually about 5-10 minutes at a time. It's hard as hell at first, but you get better, little by little. That's the great thing about it; you really feel like the more you play, the more you are actually developing a skill. Unfortunately, it's probably not a skill that's applicable outside the game, though like all fast-paced games it's probably good for hand-eye coordination. But I'd be lying if I said I didn't think beating the game was an accomplishment.

Look at steam, steam doesn't force a title. Steam reviews are well known to be more accurate than iTunes, and I think it's because they don't force a title. Coming up with a title strains the reviewer's creativity before it even begins, meaning they are prone to frustration and errors. If having a title was either optional or didn't exist reviewing apps would be a much better experience for everyone, and could even yield more accurate results.

oh right the game...
its good.

I cannot overstate how much I love this game. The controls are snappy, the visuals crisp, the music energizing. It perfectly hits the "hard but fair" sweet spot. At first you can't survive for more than a few seconds on the first level but you keep playing, getting better and finally you are so very close to the 60 second mark on the final level and then you complete it and the high when you do is unmatched.

Give the game a try. If you like it, you'll love it and if you don't, you've probably wasted more money on a terrible movie or buying food that you didn't end up eating and had to throw away because it got all moldy and gross.

Bogus. That's what I have to say. 

This game is incredibly samey. If I'd known what I was getting into, I wouldn't have paid 99¬¢ for this, let alone four bucks. 

Save your money and play something else.
The game is cool and all but it gets boring quick and it's not good enough to charge $2.99. In the end it's just a waist of money and you should look for an app that will actually last you longer.
Still a broken stupid game I'm sorry but it's true
This app is not for wimpy gamers. I'm addicted.
Yay

title.label: Best game I have ever played

I have had Super Hexagon for 2 years and I finally beat it.  (Yes all 6 frustrating levels).  Honestly I haven't found a game that I could hold onto for that long, and Super Hexagon kept pulling me in to beat my score over and over again...  If you don't have any good games, get this masterpiece.

title.label: Hate it don't wast freaking 3 dollars

content.label: The controls are so sensitive and believe me I want to rate -5 but I can't if you fix the controls then this would be a game worth getting just bc you see a good comment doesn't mean you have to play it don't wast your money

Q: PC or Mobile version?
A: They're basically identical. If you want a bigger screen to play on, maybe go for the PC version. Otherwise, this version has much more precise controls thanks to the touchscreen. 

Q: How hard is this game?
A: Hard. 

Q: I kind of want to buy this but it's also kind of $3...
A: This game is as rewarding as it is frustrating. If you think you'll like this game, you'll probably like this game. 

Q: How's the music?
A: Great, it compliments the game very well.

Q: I've never tried a game like this before and I give up easily. Should I still buy this game?
A: This game is frustrating, but every time you play you 1-up your muscle memory a little. You learn the control sensitivity, and to predict the obstacles if that level. Little by little you start to add seconds to the clock, until you beat it. 

Q: What's the best part about this game?
A: Showing it to a friend so they can think you have super-human reflexes (you will after playing this).

Q: How long will it take me to beat the first level/whole game?
A: It will obviously differ per person, all of us learn differently. The first level I can confidently say most people will beat in 1-2 hours. The whole game will probably be closer to 50 hours. 

Q: How are the controls?
A: They take some getting used to, especially in faster levels. You'll master it in no time, they're set the way they are for a reason.

Q: Is it worth the $3?
A: Personally, I say yes. It's a great game for taking on the go that will frustrate and reward you as you play. 

Q: I'm not sure if I want to buy it yet or not...
A: There's a flash version resembling the first level online called "Hexagon" by the creator of this game. It was a prototype project that eventually molded into this final game. It lags a little and the graphics aren't as good, but it's free and it'll give you a good idea as to whether you should buy this game or not. By the way, flash doesn't work on iPhone/iPad.

title.label: Please add more modes or make it harder

content.label: Please make it more difficult and add more patterns for obstacles.

title.label: One of the best games on the App Store

content.label: It's great, it's fast, it sounds awesome, it's VERY replayable,  and it is unforgiving.

This game makes you say "Holy what the... what?" as you learn how to play it. It is an amazing game, I can't stop playing it!

You think that this game is kind of a pick up and play game, but noooooo... Strap up for hours of fun and frustration, because this game brings a whole new definition to "addicting". Every time you always say "Just one more round..." then you die, of course respawning saying "Oh that death didn't count, because [Insert lame excuse here] happened I will play just once more..." Well, you get the picture.

Oh and need I mention the fact that you will probably be playing this game for years? Not because that it is addicting, but because it is frustrating. Either you beat the level and feel super satisfied, always coming back for more, or you throw your phone against the wall and have to wait to buy a new one... Adding up to the years previously mentioned.

Alright, alright, jokes aside, this game really is worth five stars, you get so much fun for that amount of money. Totes worth it!!!
This game is too hard for me, so I would like to have a slow time down feature...oh wait, I already do by triple tapping screen, inverting color. Lags game, half speed lol

title.label: Love it, but newer iPhones = dodgy controls

content.label: I LOVE this game, though it seems the controls will randomly become unresponsive on the newer iPhones (those with 3D Touch) ‚Äîno issues on the iPhone 5, 5c and 5s ...I now use my mom's old iPhone 5c as a dedicated unit for this and the other games that have similar issues on the newer phones (like infinity blade)
I was hesitant getting the app for three dollars that didn't show a video of the gameplay. I did it anyway and it was totally worth it. Get this app now.
Extremely satisfying, especially in the later difficulties.
This game is fun but I can't be the first level. Even the first level is too hard.

This is one of my favorite mobile games it just takes getting used to and the game will be fun. The music is also great. Warning if you are slow at games then don't play this  you need to be fast. I already made it to the last level
